intro: Bartsia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian whorltongue, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Bartsia peruviana is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and unique foliage structure.
